subject: AI & Agents
title: Self-Driving Cars: From DARPA to Waymo
description: One-minute skill: Self-Driving Cars: From DARPA to Waymo.

hook.text: In 2004, no car finished the DARPA Grand Challenge. In 2024, Waymo drives millions of miles with no driver.

buildup.text: The DARPA challenges in 2004 and 2005 kickstarted autonomous vehicle research.

discovery.text: Stanley, from Stanford, won the 2005 race using LIDAR, cameras, and machine learning.

twist.text: Twenty years later, fully autonomous driving is still limited to specific cities and conditions.

climax.text: Waymo and Cruise operate commercial robotaxis, but universal self-driving remains elusive.

punchline.text: We solved driving in Phoenix. The whole world is much harder.

quiz.question: What happened at the first DARPA Grand Challenge in 2004?
options: No autonomous vehicle finished the course
